climbs.name: Lacy Gibbet
climbs.fa: Frank Campbell and John Rowe Jan 1985

content.description:
The final pillar makes the approach and the more forgettable earlier pitches worth it. The platonic ideal of a WI5 high above the valley floor. Do it once.

P1) WI3/+ to a bolted anchor on the right 45m

P2-3) A couple steps of lower angle ice and snow slopes past three bolted anchors ~120m

P4) WI4 curtain to bolts on the right 45m

P5) WI5 wide free-standing pillar (bolts?) 35m

P6) WI3 rolling ice to the top and a final bolted anchor 45m

Rappel the route from bolts with 70s, one v-thread necessary(?) after the anchor at the top



Hike up the South Ghost to Second Ghost Lake. Go to the west side of the lake, then cut right through woods into the toe of the drainage. Stay right at any forks. The second narrow section cliffs out and is passed above on the right. 2-3.5 hours

Screws
On the north side of the South Ghost, from the east end of Lake Minnewanka to the Second Ghost Lake
